title: Incorrect local chef repository path generated in 2.0.4
body:
### Vagrant version
2.0.4

### Host operating system
Windows 10 Home

### Guest operating system
Ubuntu 16.04

### Vagrantfile
```ruby
# -*- mode: ruby -*-
# vi: set ft=ruby :

Vagrant.configure(2) do |config|
  config.vm.box = "bento/ubuntu-16.04"
  config.vm.provision :chef_solo do |chef|
    chef.add_recipe "hello::default"
  end
end
```
There is a single cookbook residing at `cookbooks\hello\recipes\default.rb` containing
```ruby
log "hello"
```

### Debug output
https://gist.github.com/adfinlay/ed5239f1a1d903f754fb55b1b3bc9fc2

### Expected behavior
Vagrant up to complete successfully

### Actual behavior
```
ERROR: #<Errno::ENOENT: No such file or directory @ dir_s_mkdir - /c:/tmp/vagrant-chef/nodes>
```

I believe that this stems from 
```
INFO: Started chef-zero at chefzero://localhost:1 with repository at /tmp/vagrant-chef/92ccefe09503341cb0a561e9efc78243, /c:/tmp/vagrant-chef
```
indicating that the local repository is being given an incorrect path.

I see that https://github.com/hashicorp/vagrant/pull/9490/files was included in 2.0.4 and I wonder if this has something to do with the problem as 2.0.3 works fine.

### Steps to reproduce
1. Fresh install of vagrant 2.0.4
2. Fresh install of Virtualbox 5.2.10-122406
3. Copy provided Vagrantfile and cookbook to a directory
4. Run `vagrant up`
